definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: But the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the LORD exceedingly.
sentences.chinese: 所多玛人在耶和华面前罪大恶极。
为什么说过量生产“罪大恶极”？

sentences.english: They are traitors who have committed towering crimes and deserve more than death.
sentences.chinese: 他们是罪大恶极，死有余辜的叛徒。

sentences.english: Death still leaves a margin of inexpiable guilt.
sentences.chinese: 形容罪大恶极，即使处死刑也抵偿不了他的罪恶。

sentences.english: The death penalty should be an option for the most serious crimes.
sentences.chinese: 死刑应是对罪大恶极的犯罪分子的一项选择。

sentences.english: Sentencing one flagitious man to death can prevent the man from committing a crime again.
sentences.chinese: 对一个罪大恶极的犯人施死刑，就阻止了此人再犯罪。

definition: death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
to have disregard for human life (idiom)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
